metadata.purpose: Topic-to-standards mapping for curriculum generation agent - Math and ELA grades 6-8
metadata.notes: Focused on at-promise student intervention with detailed prerequisites and misconceptions

6.RP.A.1.description: Understand the concept of a ratio and use ratio language to describe a ratio relationship between two quantities

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing ratio order - thinking 2:3 is the same as 3:2
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Ask student to describe ratio of boys to girls when there are 2 boys and 3 girls
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use concrete manipulatives, emphasize 'for every' language

common_misconceptions.misconception: Adding instead of multiplying to find equivalent ratios
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Given 2:3, student says 4:5 is equivalent (added 2 to each)
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use ratio tables, show multiplicative relationship visually

6.RP.A.2.description: Understand the concept of a unit rate a/b associated with a ratio a:b

common_misconceptions.misconception: Dividing in wrong order to find unit rate
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: $15 for 3 items - student divides 3÷15 instead of 15÷3
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize 'per ONE' - what do we want one of?

6.RP.A.3.description: Use ratio and rate reasoning to solve real-world problems

sub_standards.6.RP.A.3a: Make tables of equivalent ratios, find missing values, plot on coordinate plane
sub_standards.6.RP.A.3b: Solve unit rate problems (unit pricing, constant speed)
sub_standards.6.RP.A.3c: Find percent of a quantity as rate per 100; find whole given part and percent
sub_standards.6.RP.A.3d: Use ratio reasoning to convert measurement units

common_misconceptions.misconception: Percent means 'out of 100' only - can't apply to other quantities
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student can't find 30% of 50 because 50 isn't 100
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use double number lines, show percent as rate per 100

common_misconceptions.misconception: Cross-multiply without understanding why
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student can execute procedure but can't explain or check reasonableness
common_misconceptions.intervention: Build conceptual foundation with tape diagrams first

6.NS.A.1.description: Interpret and compute quotients of fractions, solve word problems with division of fractions

common_misconceptions.misconception: Dividing fractions same as whole numbers - larger ÷ smaller
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student thinks 1/2 ÷ 1/4 = 1/2 because 'you can't divide small by big'
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use visual models - 'how many 1/4s fit in 1/2?'

common_misconceptions.misconception: Flip the wrong fraction when using 'keep-change-flip'
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student flips the dividend instead of divisor
common_misconceptions.intervention: Connect to meaning - we're finding 'how many groups of [divisor]'

common_misconceptions.misconception: Whole number bias - thinking 1/4 ÷ 1/2 should be bigger than 1/4
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student expects quotient to be larger because division 'makes things smaller'

6.NS.B.2.description: Fluently divide multi-digit numbers using standard algorithm

common_misconceptions.misconception: Forgetting to include zeros as placeholders
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student gets 12 instead of 102 for 306÷3
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize place value columns, use graph paper

6.NS.B.3.description: Fluently add, subtract, multiply, divide multi-digit decimals

common_misconceptions.misconception: Lining up numbers by last digit instead of decimal point
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student aligns 3.5 + 2.75 as if they were whole numbers
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use place value charts, emphasize decimal alignment

common_misconceptions.misconception: Thinking 1.45 > 1.5 because 45 > 5
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student orders decimals by comparing digits after decimal as whole numbers
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use money contexts, number lines, equivalent decimals (1.5 = 1.50)

6.NS.B.4.description: Find GCF of two numbers ≤100, LCM of two numbers ≤12, use distributive property

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing GCF and LCM
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student finds LCM when asked for GCF
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use Venn diagrams of factors, emphasize 'greatest' vs 'least'

6.NS.C.5.description: Understand positive and negative numbers describe opposite directions/values

common_misconceptions.misconception: Thinking negative numbers don't exist or are 'imaginary'
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says you can't have less than zero
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use temperature, elevation, money (debt) contexts

6.NS.C.6.description: Understand rational numbers as points on number line, extend to coordinate plane
prerequisites: understanding of fractions on number line

common_misconceptions.misconception: Reversing x and y coordinates
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student plots (3,5) by going up 3 and right 5
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use 'x comes before y alphabetically - x first (horizontal), then y (vertical)'

6.NS.C.7.description: Understand ordering and absolute value of rational numbers

common_misconceptions.misconception: Thinking -7 > -3 because 7 > 3
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student orders negative numbers as if they were positive
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use number line, temperature contexts consistently

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing absolute value with 'making positive'
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student thinks |-5| = 5 means -5 'becomes' positive
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize distance from zero - 'how far from zero?'

6.NS.C.8.description: Solve problems by graphing in all four quadrants

common_misconceptions.misconception: Can't find distance between points with same x or y coordinate
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student doesn't connect absolute value to distance
common_misconceptions.intervention: Count on number line first, then connect to absolute value

6.EE.A.1.description: Write and evaluate numerical expressions with whole-number exponents

common_misconceptions.misconception: Thinking 3² means 3×2=6 instead of 3×3=9
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student multiplies base by exponent
common_misconceptions.intervention: Expand notation: 3² = 3×3, use repeated multiplication language

6.EE.A.2.description: Write, read, and evaluate expressions with variables

common_misconceptions.misconception: Thinking 5x + 4 = 9x (combining unlike terms)
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student adds coefficient and constant
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use algebra tiles, emphasize 'x's and numbers are different types'

common_misconceptions.misconception: Variable always equals specific value
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student thinks x always equals same number
common_misconceptions.intervention: Substitute multiple values, show expression gives different results

common_misconceptions.misconception: Interpreting 3x as '3 and x' or '3+x' instead of '3 times x'
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student doesn't recognize implied multiplication
common_misconceptions.intervention: Explicit instruction on algebraic notation conventions

6.EE.A.3.description: Apply properties of operations to generate equivalent expressions

common_misconceptions.misconception: Distributing only to first term: 3(x+2) = 3x+2
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student multiplies only first term inside parentheses
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use area model, emphasize 'multiply EACH term'

6.EE.A.4.description: Identify when two expressions are equivalent

common_misconceptions.misconception: Expressions that look different can't be equivalent
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says y+y+y ≠ 3y because they look different
common_misconceptions.intervention: Substitute values to verify, build conceptual understanding

6.EE.B.5.description: Understand solving equation/inequality as finding values that make it true

common_misconceptions.misconception: Equal sign means 'calculate' not 'balance'
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student writes 8 for 5+3=__+2
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use balance scale model, emphasize 'same value on both sides'

6.EE.B.6.description: Use variables to represent numbers in expressions

common_misconceptions.misconception: Order doesn't matter: 'n less than 5' written as n-5 instead of 5-n
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student doesn't attend to order in subtraction/division
common_misconceptions.intervention: Test with numbers, emphasize subtraction/division aren't commutative

6.EE.B.7.description: Solve equations of form x+p=q and px=q

common_misconceptions.misconception: Operating on only one side of equation
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student subtracts from left side but not right
common_misconceptions.intervention: Balance scale model, emphasize 'what you do to one side, do to other'

common_misconceptions.misconception: Using wrong inverse operation
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student divides to undo addition
common_misconceptions.intervention: Practice identifying operations first, then finding inverse

6.EE.B.8.description: Write and represent inequalities, recognize infinite solutions

common_misconceptions.misconception: Thinking inequality has one solution
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: For x>3, student says 'x=4' only
common_misconceptions.intervention: Graph on number line, list multiple solutions, discuss 'infinitely many'

6.EE.C.9.description: Use variables to represent quantities that change in relationship

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing independent and dependent variables
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student switches which variable depends on other
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use cause-effect language, 'what do you control vs what happens'

6.G.A.1.description: Find area of polygons by composing/decomposing

common_misconceptions.misconception: Using slant height instead of perpendicular height for triangles
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student uses side length instead of height in triangle area
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize 'height must be perpendicular to base'

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing area and perimeter
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student adds sides when asked for area
common_misconceptions.intervention: Connect to real contexts - 'covering' vs 'going around'

6.G.A.2.description: Find volume of right rectangular prisms with fractional edge lengths

common_misconceptions.misconception: Thinking fractional dimensions don't work for volume
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student can't conceptualize fractional unit cubes
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use fraction cubes, connect to fraction multiplication

6.G.A.3.description: Draw polygons on coordinate plane given coordinates

common_misconceptions.misconception: Not connecting plotted points in correct order
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student plots points but connects randomly
common_misconceptions.intervention: Practice sequencing, label vertices in order

6.G.A.4.description: Represent 3D figures using nets, find surface area

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing surface area with volume
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student multiplies all dimensions for surface area
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize 'covering outside' vs 'filling inside'

common_misconceptions.misconception: Missing faces when calculating surface area
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student forgets top/bottom or some sides
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use nets to identify all faces, systematic counting

common_misconceptions.misconception: Thinking any question about numbers is statistical
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student identifies 'How old is the president?' as statistical
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize variability - 'will we get different answers from different sources?'

6.SP.A.2.description: Understand data distribution by center, spread, shape

6.SP.A.3.description: Recognize measures of center and variability summarize data

6.SP.B.4.description: Display numerical data in plots on number line (dot plots, histograms, box plots)

6.SP.B.5.description: Summarize numerical data sets in relation to context

common_misconceptions.misconception: Thinking mean is always 'in the middle' of data
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student expects mean to be a data value
common_misconceptions.intervention: Calculate means that aren't data values, discuss 'balance point'

7.RP.A.1.description: Compute unit rates with ratios of fractions

common_misconceptions.misconception: Can't conceptualize 'per' with fractions
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student struggles with '1/2 mile per 1/4 hour'
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use double number lines, break into simpler rates first

sub_standards.7.RP.A.2a: Test for proportionality in tables or by graphing
sub_standards.7.RP.A.2b: Identify constant of proportionality (unit rate) in various representations
sub_standards.7.RP.A.2d: Explain meaning of point (x,y) on graph, especially (0,0) and (1,r)

common_misconceptions.misconception: Any linear relationship is proportional
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says y=2x+3 is proportional
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize graph must pass through origin, test (0,0)

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing additive and multiplicative relationships
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student uses addition pattern instead of multiplication
common_misconceptions.intervention: Explore both types, emphasize proportional = 'times as much'

7.RP.A.3.description: Use proportional relationships for multistep ratio and percent problems

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing percent increase with new value
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: For 20% increase on $50, student says $20 instead of $60
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize 'increase' means original + increase

common_misconceptions.misconception: Calculating successive percents incorrectly
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: For 10% off then 10% off, student says 20% off
common_misconceptions.intervention: Work through each step separately, show base changes

7.NS.A.1.description: Apply properties to add and subtract rational numbers

sub_standards.7.NS.A.1a: Adding rational numbers with same/different signs
sub_standards.7.NS.A.1b: p + q as distance |q| from p

common_misconceptions.misconception: Two negatives always make positive (applies to multiplication, not addition)
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says -3 + (-5) = 8
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use number line, debt/credit contexts

common_misconceptions.misconception: Subtracting a negative is same as subtracting positive
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says 5 - (-3) = 2
common_misconceptions.intervention: 'Subtracting negative = adding positive' with number line

7.NS.A.2.description: Apply properties to multiply and divide rational numbers

sub_standards.7.NS.A.2a: Understand that negative × positive = negative, negative × negative = positive
sub_standards.7.NS.A.2b: Understand integers can be divided if divisor not zero
sub_standards.7.NS.A.2d: Convert rational numbers to decimals, know decimals expand/repeat

common_misconceptions.misconception: Sign rules apply wrong direction
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says negative × negative = negative

7.NS.A.3.description: Solve real-world problems with rational number operations

7.EE.A.1.description: Apply properties to add, subtract, factor, expand linear expressions

common_misconceptions.misconception: Factoring errors - not identifying common factor
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student can't factor 6x + 12 as 6(x+2)
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use area model, identify what each term has in common

7.EE.A.2.description: Understand rewriting expressions shows how quantities are related

common_misconceptions.misconception: Not seeing why rewriting helps solve problems
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student can simplify but doesn't see why it matters
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use percent context - 'increase by 5%' = 'multiply by 1.05'

7.EE.B.3.description: Solve multi-step real-world problems with rational numbers

7.EE.B.4.description: Use variables in equations and inequalities

sub_standards.7.EE.B.4a: Solve equations px + q = r and p(x + q) = r
sub_standards.7.EE.B.4b: Solve inequalities px + q > r or px + q < r, graph solutions

common_misconceptions.misconception: Order of operations reversal when solving
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: For 2x + 5 = 11, student divides by 2 first
common_misconceptions.intervention: 'Undo' in reverse order - last operation done, first undone

common_misconceptions.misconception: Forgetting to flip inequality when multiplying/dividing by negative
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student solves -2x > 6 as x > -3 instead of x < -3
common_misconceptions.intervention: Test solutions, explore why sign flips with examples

7.G.A.1.description: Solve problems with scale drawings, compute actual lengths and areas

common_misconceptions.misconception: Using scale factor for area instead of scale factor squared
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: If scale is 1:2, student says area is 1:2 instead of 1:4
common_misconceptions.intervention: Explore with squares - doubling sides quadruples area

7.G.A.2.description: Draw geometric shapes with given conditions, triangle conditions

common_misconceptions.misconception: Any three lengths can form a triangle
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student tries to make triangle from 1, 2, 5
common_misconceptions.intervention: Triangle inequality exploration with manipulatives

7.G.B.4.description: Know formulas for area and circumference of circles

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing radius and diameter in formulas
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student uses diameter in A = πr²
common_misconceptions.intervention: Consistent labeling, 'r for radius' explicit instruction

common_misconceptions.misconception: Thinking π = 3.14 exactly
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student doesn't understand π is irrational
common_misconceptions.intervention: Discuss approximation vs. exact, π as special number

7.G.B.5.description: Use facts about supplementary, complementary, vertical, adjacent angles

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing supplementary (180°) and complementary (90°)
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student adds to wrong total
common_misconceptions.intervention: Mnemonics: 'C comes before S' - 90 before 180

7.G.B.6.description: Solve problems involving area, surface area, volume of 2D and 3D shapes

7.SP.A.1.description: Understand statistics uses sampling to learn about population

common_misconceptions.misconception: Bigger sample always better, regardless of how selected
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student doesn't consider bias in sampling method
common_misconceptions.intervention: Explore biased samples, discuss representative vs. convenient

7.SP.A.2.description: Use data from random sample to draw inferences about population

7.SP.B.3.description: Compare two populations using measures of center and variability

7.SP.B.4.description: Compare two populations using measures from random samples

7.SP.C.5.description: Understand probability as number between 0 and 1

common_misconceptions.misconception: Probability can be greater than 1 or negative
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student gives probability as 1.5 or -0.3
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize 0-1 range, connect to percent (0-100%)

common_misconceptions.misconception: Adding probabilities for 'and' instead of multiplying
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: For P(A and B), student adds instead of multiplies for independent events
common_misconceptions.intervention: Use tree diagrams, visualize sample space

8.NS.A.1.description: Know irrational numbers exist, approximate them with rationals

common_misconceptions.misconception: All decimals are rational
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student thinks π = 3.14 exactly
common_misconceptions.intervention: Explore non-repeating, non-terminating decimals

common_misconceptions.misconception: √2 can be written as exact fraction
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student tries to find fraction equal to √2
common_misconceptions.intervention: Historical proof, calculator exploration

8.NS.A.2.description: Use rational approximations of irrational numbers

8.EE.A.1.description: Know and apply properties of integer exponents

common_misconceptions.misconception: Negative exponent makes number negative
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says 2⁻³ = -8 instead of 1/8
common_misconceptions.intervention: Pattern exploration: 2³, 2², 2¹, 2⁰, 2⁻¹...

common_misconceptions.misconception: Adding exponents when multiplying bases
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says 2³ × 3² = 5⁵
common_misconceptions.intervention: Expand to show why bases must be same

8.EE.A.2.description: Use square root and cube root symbols, evaluate roots

common_misconceptions.misconception: √25 = 12.5 (dividing by 2 instead of finding root)
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student divides by 2 for square root
common_misconceptions.intervention: Connect to inverse of squaring, 'what times itself = 25?'

common_misconceptions.misconception: Square root of negative exists in reals
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student tries to find √-9
common_misconceptions.intervention: Explore: no real number times itself = negative

8.EE.A.3.description: Use scientific notation to estimate very large/small quantities

common_misconceptions.misconception: Larger exponent always means larger number
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says 3×10⁻² > 5×10⁻³ because -2 > -3
common_misconceptions.intervention: Convert to standard form to compare, number line

8.EE.B.5.description: Graph proportional relationships, interpret unit rate as slope

common_misconceptions.misconception: Slope and y-intercept confused
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student identifies y-intercept as slope
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize slope = steepness = rise/run

8.EE.B.6.description: Use similar triangles to explain slope consistency, derive y=mx and y=mx+b

8.EE.C.7.description: Solve linear equations in one variable

sub_standards.8.EE.C.7a: Recognize one solution, no solution, or infinitely many solutions
sub_standards.8.EE.C.7b: Solve with rational coefficients, use distributive property, collect like terms

common_misconceptions.misconception: Equations must have exactly one solution
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student can't interpret 2=2 or 3=5 as result
common_misconceptions.intervention: Explore identity equations and contradictions

common_misconceptions.misconception: Variables on both sides means no solution
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student gives up when seeing 3x+2=x+8
common_misconceptions.intervention: Practice 'gathering variables on one side'

8.EE.C.8.description: Analyze and solve systems of linear equations

sub_standards.8.EE.C.8b: Solve systems algebraically and by graphing

common_misconceptions.misconception: Parallel lines have one solution
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student expects all systems to have intersection
common_misconceptions.intervention: Graph parallel lines, discuss 'no solution' meaning

common_misconceptions.misconception: Substitution works with any variable regardless of simplicity
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student makes errors with complex substitution
common_misconceptions.intervention: Teach choosing 'easiest' variable to isolate

8.F.A.1.description: Understand function assigns exactly one output to each input

common_misconceptions.misconception: Function must be formula
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student doesn't recognize table or graph as function
common_misconceptions.intervention: Explore multiple representations of same function

common_misconceptions.misconception: Same output for different inputs means 'not a function'
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says f(1)=3 and f(2)=3 can't be a function
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize 'each input ONE output' - outputs can repeat

8.F.A.2.description: Compare functions represented differently (algebraically, graphically, table, description)

8.F.A.3.description: Interpret equation y=mx+b as defining linear function

common_misconceptions.misconception: All equations are linear functions
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student doesn't distinguish y=x² from y=2x
common_misconceptions.intervention: Graph both, compare shapes and growth patterns

8.F.B.4.description: Construct function to model linear relationship
topics: finding slope and intercept from data

8.F.B.5.description: Describe qualitative features of function from graph

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing the function with its graph
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student says 'the function goes up' instead of 'as x increases, y increases'
common_misconceptions.intervention: Practice precise language about function behavior

8.G.A.1.description: Verify properties of rotations, reflections, translations experimentally

common_misconceptions.misconception: Rotation always around origin
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student can't rotate around other points
common_misconceptions.intervention: Practice with various centers of rotation

8.G.A.3.description: Describe effect of dilations, translations, rotations, reflections on 2D figures with coordinates

8.G.A.5.description: Use informal arguments to establish angle facts

common_misconceptions.misconception: Exterior angle = adjacent interior angle
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student confuses exterior angle relationships
common_misconceptions.intervention: Draw and measure, establish exterior angle theorem

8.G.B.6.description: Explain proof of Pythagorean Theorem and its converse

common_misconceptions.misconception: a² + b² = c² works for any triangle
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student applies to non-right triangles
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize 'right triangle only', test with non-right triangles

common_misconceptions.misconception: c is always the longest side regardless of labeling
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student doesn't identify hypotenuse correctly
common_misconceptions.intervention: 'c is the hypotenuse - across from the right angle'

8.G.B.7.description: Apply Pythagorean Theorem to find unknown side lengths

8.G.B.8.description: Apply Pythagorean Theorem to find distance in coordinate system

8.G.C.9.description: Know volume formulas for cones, cylinders, spheres

common_misconceptions.misconception: Confusing height with slant height for cones
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student uses slant height in V = (1/3)πr²h
common_misconceptions.intervention: Emphasize 'height' is perpendicular to base

8.SP.A.1.description: Construct and interpret scatter plots for bivariate data

8.SP.A.2.description: Know that straight lines model relationships with linear association

common_misconceptions.misconception: Line must pass through all points
common_misconceptions.diagnosis: Student tries to connect all dots
common_misconceptions.intervention: Discuss 'best fit' - minimize overall distance

8.SP.A.3.description: Use equation of linear model to solve problems; interpret slope and intercept

8.SP.A.4.description: Understand patterns of association in bivariate categorical data

ratios_to_functions.description: How ratio concepts build to linear functions

RL.6.1.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis of explicit text and inferences

common_difficulties.difficulty: Copying entire sentences instead of selecting relevant evidence
common_difficulties.indicator: Student quotes full paragraphs without connection to claim
common_difficulties.support_strategy: Teach highlighting specific words/phrases, use evidence sentence starters

common_difficulties.indicator: Student only uses directly stated information
common_difficulties.support_strategy: Model thinking aloud about 'reading between the lines'

RL.6.2.description: Determine theme/central idea, how conveyed through details; summarize without opinions

common_difficulties.difficulty: Confusing theme with topic or plot
common_difficulties.indicator: Student says theme is 'friendship' instead of 'true friends support each other'
common_difficulties.support_strategy: Theme = message/lesson, not just what it's about

common_difficulties.indicator: Student writes 'it was a good story because...'
common_difficulties.support_strategy: Practice objective language, 'the author' vs. 'I think'

RL.6.3.description: Describe how plot unfolds and characters respond/change

RL.6.4.description: Determine word/phrase meanings including figurative and connotative; analyze word choice impact

common_difficulties.indicator: Student interprets 'heart of gold' as actual gold
common_difficulties.support_strategy: Build figurative language recognition, ask 'does this make literal sense?'

RL.6.5.description: Analyze how sentence, chapter, scene, stanza fits into structure and contributes to development

RL.6.6.description: Explain how author develops point of view of narrator/speaker

RL.6.7.description: Compare/contrast reading experience to audio, video, or live version

RL.6.9.description: Compare/contrast texts in different forms/genres on similar themes

RL.6.10.description: Read and comprehend literature in grades 6-8 complexity band

RI.6.1.description: Cite textual evidence to support analysis

common_difficulties.difficulty: Finding evidence in dense informational text
common_difficulties.indicator: Student struggles to locate relevant information
common_difficulties.support_strategy: Teach annotation strategies, use graphic organizers

RI.6.2.description: Determine central idea, how conveyed through details; provide objective summary

RI.6.3.description: Analyze how key individual, event, or idea is introduced, illustrated, elaborated

RI.6.4.description: Determine meaning of words including figurative, connotative, technical meanings

RI.6.5.description: Analyze how sentence, paragraph, chapter, section fits into structure

RI.6.6.description: Determine author's point of view or purpose, explain how conveyed

common_difficulties.difficulty: Distinguishing author's view from facts presented
common_difficulties.indicator: Student can't identify when author is expressing opinion
common_difficulties.support_strategy: Teach signal words for opinion, practice identifying perspective

RI.6.8.description: Trace and evaluate argument, distinguish supported from unsupported claims

common_difficulties.difficulty: Accepting all claims as equally valid
common_difficulties.support_strategy: Teach criteria for evaluating evidence, practice with examples

RI.6.9.description: Compare/contrast one author's presentation with another on same events

W.6.1.description: Write arguments to support claims with clear reasons and relevant evidence

common_difficulties.difficulty: Distinguishing claim from reason from evidence
common_difficulties.support_strategy: Use color coding, graphic organizers for argument structure
Practice selecting and explaining evidence relevance

W.6.2.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic

W.6.3.description: Write narratives with effective technique, relevant details, well-structured sequences

W.6.4.description: Produce clear, coherent writing appropriate to task, purpose, audience

W.6.5.description: Develop writing by planning, revising, editing, rewriting

W.6.6.description: Use technology to produce and publish writing

W.6.7.description: Conduct short research projects from several sources

W.6.8.description: Gather relevant information, assess credibility, quote/paraphrase, avoid plagiarism

common_difficulties.support_strategy: Explicit instruction on plagiarism, practice paraphrasing

W.6.9.description: Draw evidence from texts to support analysis and research

W.6.10.description: Write routinely over extended and shorter time frames

SL.6.1.description: Engage in collaborative discussions on grade 6 topics

SL.6.3.description: Delineate speaker's argument and claims, evaluate reasoning

SL.6.4.description: Present claims with logical sequence and relevant descriptions/facts

SL.6.6.description: Adapt speech to variety of contexts

L.6.1.description: Demonstrate command of standard English grammar

L.6.3.description: Use knowledge of language for effectiveness

L.6.5.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and word relationships

progression_from_6.reading: More complex inference, multiple central ideas, compare across texts
progression_from_6.writing: Acknowledge alternate claims in argument, more sophisticated organization
progression_from_6.speaking_listening: Track multiple speakers, present findings with visual displays
progression_from_6.language: More complex sentence structures, nuanced word meanings

key_standards.RL.7.1: Cite SEVERAL pieces of textual evidence (vs. just 'cite' in grade 6)
key_standards.RL.7.2: Analyze development of theme OVER COURSE OF TEXT
key_standards.RI.7.8: Assess whether reasoning is SOUND and evidence is RELEVANT AND SUFFICIENT

progression_from_7.reading: Most strongly supporting evidence, central idea development and relationship to supporting ideas
progression_from_7.writing: Counterclaims in argument, more formal academic style
progression_from_7.speaking_listening: Evaluate speaker's point of view, reasoning, use of evidence
progression_from_7.language: Active/passive voice, verbals, more sophisticated punctuation

key_standards.RL.8.1: Cite evidence that MOST STRONGLY supports analysis
key_standards.RI.8.2: Central idea development INCLUDING RELATIONSHIP TO SUPPORTING IDEAS
key_standards.RI.8.6: Analyze how author ACKNOWLEDGES AND RESPONDS TO conflicting viewpoints
key_standards.W.8.1: Write arguments with CLAIMS, COUNTERCLAIMS, reasons, evidence

common_patterns.description: Struggle with decoding despite adequate language comprehension

indicators: Can read fluently but can't answer questions

at_promise_considerations: Focus on meaning-making, not just accuracy

selecting_standards.by_topic: Use topic arrays within each standard to match user's requested topic to relevant standards
selecting_standards.by_readiness: If student is below grade level, look at prerequisites to identify gaps; if above, look at next grade's standards in same domain

using_misconceptions.purpose: Proactively address common errors when generating content
using_misconceptions.for_assessment: Use diagnosis questions to identify if student holds misconception
using_misconceptions.for_intervention: Use intervention strategies when misconception detected

learning_progressions.for_remediation: Trace back through progression to find prerequisite gaps
learning_progressions.for_extension: Follow progression forward for students ready for more

micro_lesson_structure_suggestions.5_min: Focus on single concept or skill, one example, one practice item
micro_lesson_structure_suggestions.10_min: Hook + direct instruction + 2-3 practice items + self-check
micro_lesson_structure_suggestions.15_min: Hook + direct instruction + guided practice + independent practice + wrap-up
micro_lesson_structure_suggestions.20_min: Full lesson arc with differentiated practice paths
